data.title: Fishing With A Stick
data.solution:
#        [  ]
#       [  ]
#       [  ]         ---| Fishing With A Stick |---
#       [  ]
#      [  ]
#      [__]
#     [__]                __----__
#      //                /    _-----
#     //              __/      |___           /\
#    //              /   ____      ---___    / |
#   //  |\          /.. /(0)             --_/  /
#   ||_(| \        /______   |     \          |
#   \(_)| /)        vvvvv|   \     /    __--\ \
#   (_)__/(_)      /^^^^/     \___/____/     \/
#   (_)  (_)       \_          ___/
#  (_)   {:c}        \________/

# SOLUTION

# (1) INPUT
h  = int(input())
w  = int(input())
current_d = (1 if input()=='RIGHT' else -1)

# (2) MY VARIABLES
rows        = []
stick_x     = None
stick_h     = 1
trash       = []
left_fish   = []
right_fish  = []
fish_caught = 0


# (2.1) LOAD MY VARIABLES
for y in range(h):
    row = input()

    if stick_x==None:
        stick_x = row.find('|')
        if stick_x<0:
            stick_x = row.find('C')

    for x in range(len(row)):
        if y!=0 and (x==stick_x and rows[y-1][x]=='|'): stick_h += 1

        if x==stick_x or (x==stick_x and (row[x-1]=='|' or row[x-1])) or row[x]=='.': continue
        elif row[x]=='<': left_fish.append([x,y])
        elif row[x]=='>': right_fish.append([x,y])
        else:trash.append([x, y])

    rows.append(row)


# (3) LOOP

# (3.1) VARIABLES FROM THE LOOP
the_stick_is_broken = False
iloop = 0

# (3.2) THE LOOP
while not the_stick_is_broken and iloop<(max([w-(stick_x+1), stick_x-1])):

    # (3.2.3) MOVE ALL RIGHT FISHS
    for coor in right_fish[:]:
        coor[0]+=1
        if coor[0]==stick_x and coor[1]<stick_h:
            fish_caught+=1
            right_fish.remove(coor)

    # (3.2.4) MOVE ALL LEFT FISHS
    for coor in left_fish[:]:
        coor[0]+=-1
        if coor[0]==stick_x and coor[1]<stick_h:
            fish_caught+=1
            left_fish.remove(coor)



    # (3.2.5) DETECT COLLISION BETWEEN THE FISHS
    for lfish in left_fish[:]:
        for rfish in right_fish[:]:
            if rfish==lfish or (lfish[1]==rfish[1] and lfish[0]-rfish[0] == -1):
                right_fish.remove(rfish)
                left_fish.remove(lfish)


    # (3.2.6) DETECT GARBAGE COLLISIONS
    for garbage in trash[:]:
        garbage[0]+=current_d
        # (3.2.6.1) DETECT IF THE STICK IS BROKEN
        if garbage[0]==stick_x and garbage[1]<stick_h:
            the_stick_is_broken=True
            break

        # (3.2.6.2) DETECT COLLISION WITH THE RIGHT FISH
        for rfish in right_fish[:]:
            if trash==rfish or garbage[1]==rfish[1] and garbage[0]-rfish[0]==-1:
                right_fish.remove(rfish)
                trash.remove(garbage)

        # (3.2.6.3) DETECT COLLISION WITH THE LEFT FISHS
        for lfish in left_fish[:]:
            if trash==lfish or garbage[1]==lfish[1] and garbage[0]-lfish[0]==1:
                left_fish.remove(lfish)
                trash.remove(garbage)
    if the_stick_is_broken:break

    # (3.2.7) sum +1 iterator
    iloop+=1

# (4) OUTPUT

# (4.1) HELP
"""
print('+-----------HELP------------')
print('| iloop:      ', iloop       )
print('| current_d:  ', current_d   )
print('| stick_x:    ', stick_x     )
print('| stick_h:    ', stick_h     )
print('| trash:      ', trash       )
print('| left_fish:  ', left_fish   )
print('| right_fish: ', right_fish  )
print('+---------------------------')
print()
print('fish_caught:', fish_caught)
"""
# (4.2) FINAL OUTPUT
print(fish_caught)
data.statement:
Your goal is to count how many fish you have caught.
You are fishing in a water with an altitude of [[H]]
and a length of [[W]] and a current
pointing towards [[currentD]] with a very cheap fishing rod,
It is broken by touching any garbage, but at least it is used to catch fish.

<<INFORMATION: >>
<<*>> ".": water
<<*>> ">": a fish that goes to the right
<<*>> "<": a fish that goes to the left
<<*>> "|": fishing rod
<<*>> "C": hook. If it is just below the fishing rod or if it is the first "C" in the first row and there is no "|", it is considered to be the fishing rod, otherwise it is garbage.
<<*>> any other character: garbage

<<RULES:>>
<<1. Fishing rod:>>
<<*>> Fish can touch any part of your fishing rod to be caught
<<*>> If the trash touches the fishing rod it breaks (you can not fish anymore)
<<*>> If garbage and fish touch the fishing rod at the same time, fish is caught (and then the rod breaks)
<<*>> There always has to be a hook

<<2. Fish:>>
<<*>> Fish can move in both directions regardless of the current
<<*>> If two fish collide with each other, they get stuck (they stop moving and disappear)
<<*>> The fish die when colliding with the garbage (the fish and garbage stop moving and disappear)

<<3. Garbage:>>
<<*>> Trash moves in the direction of the current

testCases.title: Fishing Without A Stick And Without Water
Fishing A Fishing Rod That Fishes A Fishing Rod

data.stubGenerator:
read H:int
read W:int
read currentD:string(5)
loop H read row:string(1024)
write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line1: >>[[H]] Height
<<Line2: >>[[W]] Width
<<Line3: >> [[currentD]] current direction
<<H Lines: >>[[row]] string

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Your goal is to count how many fish you have caught.
You are fishing in a water with an altitude of H
and a length of W and a current
pointing towards currentD with a very cheap fishing rod,
It is broken by touching any garbage, but at least it is used to catch fish.

INFORMATION:
* ".": water
* ">": a fish that goes to the right
* "<": a fish that goes to the left
* "|": fishing rod
* "C": hook. If it is just below the fishing rod or if it is the first "C" in the first row and there is no "|", it is considered to be the fishing rod, otherwise it is garbage.
* any other character: garbage

RULES:
1. Fishing rod:
* Fish can touch any part of your fishing rod to be caught
* If the trash touches the fishing rod it breaks (you can not fish anymore)
* If garbage and fish touch the fishing rod at the same time, fish is caught (and then the rod breaks)
* There always has to be a hook

2. Fish:
* Fish can move in both directions regardless of the current
* If two fish collide with each other, they get stuck (they stop moving and disappear)
* The fish die when colliding with the garbage (the fish and garbage stop moving and disappear)

3. Garbage:
* Trash moves in the direction of the current
Input
Line1: H Height
Line2: W Width
Line3: currentD current direction
H Lines: row string
Output
the number of fish caught
Constraints
0<H<256
0<W<256
currentD = LEFT(right to left) or RIGHT(left to right)
Example
Input
7
11
LEFT
.....|.....
...>.|....<
..><.|...#.
.>.<.|....<
.....|.<..<
.....C.....
...........
Output
2
